messages.title: Why I am backing Mohammad Yasin
messages.content: Bedford & Kempston needs a strong voice in Parliament, fighting for our hospital, our schools and effective policing. I'm confident Mohammad Yasin will be that strong voice. - Patrick Hall, Former MP for Bedford & Kempston

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight to save our NHS & Bedford Hospital
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will work hard to secure the future of our A&E, Maternity & Paediatric Services.
We need more police in our communities and I’ll campaign for funding for this.
I will fight for the right to a good education for all our young people and for reversing Tory cuts to school funding.
I will campaign for the return of a Magistrates Court to our county town.
I will back our local businesses here in Bedford & Kempston to generate growth, fair pay and employment for everyone.

mentions.candidate: I have lived in Bedford for more than 25 years with my wife and children. I have eleven years experience here as a local councillor.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: I hope you will vote for me, as a locally committed Bedford & Kempston MP who will fight for the towns' needs and stand up for the many, not just the few.

issues.education: As your MP, I will press for proper funding of our schools. Because of Tory funding cuts, state schools in Bedford and Kempston are likely to lose teaching posts. I support Labour's pledge to reverse these cuts. Also, Labour's plan to abolish tuition fees will benefit our young people.
issues.health: As your MP, I will make Bedford Hospital my top priority. Many people are rightly worried about the future of the hospital. We must make sure that A&E, Maternity & Obstetrics and Paediatric Services will be retained at Bedford Hospital to serve our growing and aging population.
issues.lawCrime: Support our local police. We need more police in our communities and I'll campaign for funding for this.

community.content: As your MP, I will support the rebuilding of public services. As a local councillor, I’ve seen first-hand the devastating impact of the Tory Government’s cuts on services and how it’s affecting people’s daily lives. Our council and police cannot carry out their duties without proper funding.

No wonder they are shocked that a Tory priority is to bring back the cruel 'sport' of fox hunting.
